channel.title: Research on Arpon Raksit
channel.description: Recent content in Research on Arpon Raksit

item.title: THH(Z) and the image of J
A motivic filtration on the topological cyclic homology of commutative ring spectra
item.description: Defines the “even filtration” on an arbitrary commutative ring spectrum; uses this to recharacterize Bhatt–Morrow–Scholze’s motivic filtrations on THH, TC–, TP, TC of quasisyntomic commutative rings (and hence their syntomic cohomology, i.e. the associated graded of the filtration on TC), and then extend these to “chromatically quasisyntomic” commutative ring spectra, such as S, MU, ku (and its Adams summand at any prime), ko, and tmf; finally, calculates the mod (p,v1) syntomic cohomology of the Adams summand at p, realizing part of a picture conjectured by Rognes.

item.title: Hochschild homology and the derived de Rham complex revisited
item.description: Develops notions of “homotopy-coherent cochain complex” and “filtered circle action”, and uses these to characterize the derived de Rham complex and HKR-filtered Hochschild homology by universal properties, as well as reconstruct the filtrations on negative and periodic cyclic homology relating these invariants to derived de Rham cohomology.

item.title: Motivic Gauss-Bonnet formulas
item.description: Proves a cohomological formula for the Grothendieck-Witt–valued Euler characteristic of smooth projective varieties given by A1-homotopy theory, using Levineâ€™s Gauss-Bonnet formula.
